speaker: Skyline
text: A crane is seen on the horizon lifting a load.  _ACT I  Scene 1 -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier enters happily._

speaker: Frasier
text: Can I get my usual, please?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you're in a good mood.  What's up?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually... no, I'd better not.  Don't want to jinx it.

speaker: Roz
text: No problem.

speaker: Frasier
text: Besides, the mark of a-a true gentleman is discretion.

speaker: Roz
text: [_not as interested as Frasier wants her to be_] Okay.  Listen, about your dad's bachelor party...

speaker: Frasier
text: Charlotte and I spent the night together.

speaker: Roz
text: I thought she was seeing that super-hottie Frank.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dumped him, thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: For you? [_then_] I mean, wow, way to go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know.  It's funny I should end up with my own matchmaker, isn't it?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I mean that Frank was the whole package.  Those eyes, that chin, that bod that wouldn't quit...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, it didn't have to quit, it was fired.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you very much. [_to Roz_] Now, you were saying something about my dad's bachelor party?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.  Weren't you having a problem deciding on the entertainment?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, there's this girl in my spin class, and she does it all -- strips, lap dances, movies.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Would I be familiar with her work?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know, have you seen "Grinding Nemo"?  Anyway, I invited her over here so you could check her out.  She's going to be here any second.  Her name is Amber Licious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, well, I'm afraid I can't do it right now.  I'm meeting Charlotte for coffee, uh-

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you can tell her yourself.  Hey, Amber!  _Amber rushes in.  She is a busty blonde with a wide smile.  Roz and Frasier rise._

speaker: Roz
text: How are you?

speaker: Amber
text: Hi!

speaker: Roz
text: This is Frasier.

speaker: Amber
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after mumbling a bit_] Hello, uh, how do you do, Miss Licious? Uh, I'm terribly sorry, but I've got something scheduled, so I'll have to postpone our interview.  Perhaps we could meet this evening at my place, around 7:00?  I live at the Elliot Bay Towers.

speaker: Amber
text: Can we make it 7:30?  I have to go re-dub some groans for "He-Biscuit."

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll see you then.  Good.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi!  Listen, I... gosh, I'm sorry I had to dash off this morning.

speaker: Charlotte
text: It's OK.  I have to dash off myself right now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I thought we were having coffee.

speaker: Charlotte
text: We were.  I forgot - I have to catch a train to Portland in twenty minutes.  I'm giving a talk to the Northwest Businesswoman's Association.  I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, it's all right.  I'm sure you'll be wonderful.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, yeah, it's a good speech.  I gave it last year to the Midwest Businesswoman's Association.  Anyway, I'll be back Sunday night.  We can have dinner then.  I really should catch a cab.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, maybe I could just drive you to the station.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, you don't have to do that.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I'd like to.  Besides, I've always been a sucker for that romantic movie-ending goodbye - a fog-shrouded train platform, a-a passionate kiss.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_agreeing_] With a romantic dip.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, maybe I am, but there are damn few of us left.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Dip, dip.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  _Frasier takes her hand, getting it.  Charlotte smiles.  FADE OUT_  _Scene 2 - On the road in Frasier's car Frasier is discussing dinner plans.  Charlotte is deep in thought._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, I could make us a reservation for dinner on Sunday. I would suggest Cucina...

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_distracted_] Yeah, okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Charlotte... you seem a little distracted.  Is there something on your mind?  Charlotte?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, boy.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Look, I-I really don't want to get into this now.  Why don't we talk about it Sunday night?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_very worried_] Please.  I can't wait till Sunday.  My imagination will torture me.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Okay. [_pause_] I'm moving back to Chicago in three weeks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Three weeks?!

speaker: Charlotte
text: It's not you.  I bought my old business back from my ex. I--I know I should have told you sooner, but it was never the right time.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Are you okay?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_under his breath_] I had to blab to Roz.

speaker: Charlotte
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_very sad_] Nothing.  Are you sure?

speaker: Charlotte
text: This all happened before we got together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's look on the bright side.  I mean, Chicago isn't that far away.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I don't want a long-distance relationship.  And neither do you.  You said so on your application.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  But, you know, we still have three weeks.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Don't be hurt, but... if someone called your show and said, "I'm leaving town in three weeks.  Should I get involved with someone?" what would you say?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd say it was foolish to take the plunge and bring up feelings that must be dashed, and so forth.  But what do I know?  I'm not infallible.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_smiling wistfully_] Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_resigned_] All right.  _He unbuckles his seat belt, and they embrace.  He caresses her gently. A train whistle is heard, and the train itself rushes by._

speaker: Charlotte
text: Son of a bitch!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  My hand slipped.

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, no, it's my train!  Damn it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  All right, look, the next station isn't too far. I'll bet I can beat the train. _FADE TO:  Scene 3 - Frasier's car Time fade to another train station.  Charlotte looks on forlornly as the whistle is heard and the train rushes by._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well.  Round two to Amtrak.  I could drive us to the next station?

speaker: Charlotte
text: All right, but, you do know you're going to have to drive a little faster.  You do realize we got passed by a school bus and a prefab home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Point taken.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I really do appreciate this.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_clearly still smarting_] Oh, it's all right.  Didn't have anything else to do. [_then, realizing_] Oh, dear.  I've got to make a call.  Could you hold the wheel, please?  _She does.  Frasier fumbles around with the wires and earpiece of a phone unit._

speaker: Frasier
text: I just got this.  It's a... it's a hands-free unit.  It's, uh, much, uh, much, much safer.  _He finally gets the unit in his ear and retakes the wheel, but the mouthpiece is pointing straight up.  CUT TO: Cafe Nervosa, where Daphne and Niles are speaking._

speaker: Daphne
text: Can't we just meet her?  Everyone in Frasier's building raves about her, and I hear she's unhappy.

speaker: Niles
text: I just hate the idea of poaching the Steingartens' nanny.

speaker: Daphne
text: I seem to recall you poaching another man's fiancee once.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne, I was in college.  I... [_off her look_] oh, you mean...

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, who did you mean?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, I have to get this.  Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, you remember that idea we proposed about Dad's party?  _Charlotte somewhat playfully moves the mouthpiece down to its proper place._

speaker: Frasier
text: The, uh, the entertainer. [_To Charlotte_] Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: The klezmer band?  _CUT back to car.  Charlotte's hand is still flirtatiously near Frasier's face after moving the mouthpiece._

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, the stripper.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, well, I found one!

speaker: Niles
text: [_nervously_] Daphne's fine, thank you for asking!  She's right here beside me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I'm supposed to interview her this evening at 7:30 at my place.  I can't make it.  Something came up.  You'll have to do it for me.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no thank you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, if you're worried about Dad being there, he's got a date with Ronee tonight.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Don't we want south?

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Niles, I-I know that you get nervous around fan dancers and their ilk, but you have got to conquer your fear...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o., continuing_] Thank you!  I'll talk to you later. Goodbye.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_nervously_] South!

speaker: Frasier
text: What, I'm sorry?

speaker: Charlotte
text: South!!  South!!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  What?

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_craning her neck as they pass the turnoff_] SOUTH!!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear, uh, you know, perhaps it would be best if you just said left or right.  It's not like there's a compass in the car.

speaker: Charlotte
text: What's that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I'll be damned.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_notices something else_] What's that red light?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that.  Uh, that's nothing to worry about.  It's been on for months.  I think there's something wrong with the bulb. _DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 4 - Dissolve to night The "door open" warning beeps.  Charlotte looks forlornly at her cell phone.  Frasier enters the car._

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_with an ironic smile_] Cell phones don't work here.  Please tell me you know what's wrong with the car?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not a clue.  I opened the hood as a mere formality.  _Charlotte sighs.  FADE TO:_  **NEIGHBORS DESCRIBED JONATHAN AS A NICE BOY WHO KEPT TO HIMSELF**  _Scene 5 - A country home A knock.  A rustic, pleasant woman opens the door to Frasier and Charlotte._

speaker: Sue
text: Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: We're terribly sorry to bother you, but, uh, our car has broken down.

speaker: Sue
text: Well, come on in out of that cold!

speaker: Sue
text: My husband knows everything about cars.  Harbin, these people's car broke down.  Go take a look at it for them.  Harbin!  _Harbin looks up with rather wild eyes.  He crashes something on the table and heads outside, mumbling unintelligibly under his breath._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as he passes_] Thank you!  Thank you very much.  We certainly appreciate that.

speaker: Sue
text: Well, just have a seat and have a cup of coffee and warm up. I'm Sue, by the way.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Thank you.  You're very kind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, indeed.

speaker: Charlotte
text: I'm Charlotte.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I'm Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, you seem to be preparing for some sort of party.

speaker: Sue
text: Well, Harbin's mother passed away, so people will be coming over tomorrow.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, my God!  I'm-I'm so sorry.  We should get out of your hair.

speaker: Sue
text: Oh, no, please!  The company will do us good.  I mean, Harbin really perked up when you came in.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_looking out the door_] Really?  Because he seems to be crying in our car.

speaker: Sue
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Sue
text: Harbin!  For goodness sake, pop the hood!

speaker: Sue
text: You will have to excuse him.  He was _very_ attached to his mother.  A little too attached for my tastes. [_Then_] Hi, baby! Hi! _She walks to greet her son, who has entered.  Jonathan is dressed in a "stalker" type outfit of thermal underwear under a short-sleeve shirt. He has a bald head, walks leaning backward with a sort of "reverse" hunchback, and is very creepy._

speaker: Jonathan
text: Who are these?

speaker: Sue
text: Their car broke down.  This is my son, Jonathan. [_She caresses him._] Isn't he handsome?  Jonathan, this is Frasier and Charlotte.

speaker: Jonathan
text: How do you do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, nice to meet you...  _Frasier holds out his hand, but Jonathan walks right past him and extends his hand to Charlotte, who reluctantly shakes it._

speaker: Sue
text: How is your project today, baby?

speaker: Jonathan
text: [_impatiently_] Fine, mother. [_To Charlotte_] You want a butterscotch?

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, I-I'm good.  I'm good.  So, what are you making?

speaker: Sue
text: Art.  He won't let any of us see it until it's finished.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  So, uh, how's our car?  Can we just scoot right away from here?

speaker: Harbin
text: No.  I'll-I'll have to drive to town tomorrow for the parts. So, what happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we were just, uh, driving along the highway, and then suddenly the engine just died.

speaker: Harbin
text: [_sobbing_] Excuse me.

speaker: Sue
text: Excuse me.  _She follows her husband.  Jonathan looks on from the doorway. Frasier and Charlotte are increasingly uncomfortable._

speaker: Sue
text: [_o.s._] Will you please cut out the hangdog bit, Mr. Welcome Wagon?  We've got company!  Get in there, show them some manners.  Offer them a place to stay for the night.

speaker: Jonathan
text: You're not going to like it here.

speaker: Harbin
text: Of course, uh, of course you'll have to spend the night.

speaker: Frasier
text: We couldn't.

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, we really, _really_ couldn't.  There must be a hotel in town.

speaker: Jonathan
text: What does this look like, Lancaster?

speaker: Sue
text: It's no problem.  You could bunk with Jonathan, and Charlotte, you could have the fold-out.

speaker: Jonathan
text: [_suggestively_] I'll help make up your bed...

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, that's OK!  We'll-we'll stay together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's right, together.

speaker: Sue
text: Oh, well, are you married?  Because we don't want to set a bad example for... [_motions with her head toward Jonathan_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, yes.

speaker: Charlotte
text: We're married!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, married.

speaker: Sue
text: For how long?

speaker: Frasier/Charlotte
text: [_simultaneously_] Oh, two years./Eighteen months.   _END OF ACT I  ACT II_  _Scene 6 - Frasier's apartment Martin is speaking on the phone._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Ronee.  It's me.  Uh, I've got to interview a new physical therapist to fill in for Daph, so pick me up fifteen minutes later, OK? [_Pause_] Just have a drink. [_Pause_] Well, have another one. [_Pause, concerned look_] Really?  Maybe I'll pick you up.  _He hangs up.  CUT to Niles in the elevator, also on the phone._

speaker: Niles
text: [_stiltedly_] Frasier?  You're too busy to answer the phone -- but I'm just about to interview this... stripper, and I have no idea what to ask.

speaker: Niles
text: I just hope Dad doesn't walk in and spoil the surprise.  I'm Already developing some sort of aversion-based mouth dryness as we speak. [_Then_] This is Niles, by the way.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_nervous_] Oh!

speaker: Martin
text: What's up?

speaker: Niles
text: [_stilted again_] Frasier is going to split a case of oloroso with me because we both like oloroso, but he's not here, so I'll stop bothering you.  Nice chatting.  _He blocks his nostril and sniffs, his characteristic "nosebleed of untruth" about to set in.  He exits.  Martin looks after him with puzzlement.  Reset to: Hall In the hall, Niles runs into a young woman (Becky) wearing a sweat outfit, and carrying a manila folder._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  Are you here for the interview?

speaker: Becky
text: Yes.  Crane, right?

speaker: Niles
text: Um, yes. [_He gasps a bit with mouth dryness._] Um, the place is a mess.  Do you - do you mind if we talk in the lobby?

speaker: Becky
text: I guess that's okay.  _He escorts her into the elevator.  As it starts to go down, she smiles a bit uncomfortably.  Niles becomes very stilted now._

speaker: Niles
text: Um, so, um, how -- uh - how long have you been doing what you do?

speaker: Becky
text: Oh, years now.  At first I just did it for friends, but then I thought, "Why am I giving this away when I can make money at it?"

speaker: Becky
text: Here are my references.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, I -- ahem - didn't know you people had references.  Let alone... the mayor?

speaker: Becky
text: Yeah.  I started with him, and now I do most of the city council.  _Niles again gasps a bit with the mouth dryness, and hands her back the list._

speaker: Niles
text: Well...uh, that--that's good enough for me.  You're hired.

speaker: Becky
text: Shouldn't your dad meet me before you decide?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, no.  We--we don't want him to see you till you're taking off your clothes.

speaker: Becky
text: What are you talking about?  And why are you sweating so much?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry.  I'm just--I'm just a little ill-at-ease around...

speaker: Becky
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: [_fighting the mouth dryness mightily and finally stammering_] Sex workers.

speaker: Becky
text: Ew!  Get away from me, you freak! _The elevator reaches the lobby, and she rushes out.  Daphne is waiting. Niles sees her and immediately tries to compose himself._

speaker: Niles
text: Hi.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_not expecting to see him_] Hi.  What are you doing here and why are you so sweaty?

speaker: Niles
text: [_sniffing again_] I was talking to Dad about my case of oloroso.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh.  Well, if it doesn't clear up by tomorrow, you should call a doctor.

speaker: Niles
text: I will.  [_N.B. Oloroso -- a variety of sherry._]  _He rushes away, holding the nostril tightly.  Daphne enters the elevator, talking on her cell phone._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  Hello, Kathy?  Yeah, it's Daphne Crane.  Listen, I'm going to be up in 1901, and I was wondering if we could finally meet.  Oh, that's wonderful!  Don't even call it an interview.  Everyone says you're the best nanny in Seattle. Good, I'll see you up there then.  _The door closes.  Upon her arrival, Daphne exits to find Amber waiting at the door._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, wow, that was fast.  Come on in.

speaker: Amber
text: [_confused_] All right, what happened to Dr. Crane?

speaker: Daphne
text: He's not feeling well.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks for coming.  I know you're busy.  Please, have a seat.

speaker: Amber
text: Oh, thanks.  Teah, right after this I have to go pick up a new teddy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that's so sweet.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'll make this quick then.  We're not expecting anything fancy.  Just the basic burping, diapering, and so forth.

speaker: Amber
text: O-kay, I guess I'm game for that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, wonderful!  Why don't I make some tea and we can talk.

speaker: Amber
text: Great!  Uh, did you want me to wear something special?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh!  Since you asked, I've always been partial to a simple white nurse's uniform.

speaker: Amber
text: It's a classic.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, I thought I heard some talking out here!  I'm Marty Crane.

speaker: Amber
text: Hi.

speaker: Martin
text: How you doing?

speaker: Amber
text: Great.

speaker: Martin
text: So, Daphne give you the third degree?

speaker: Amber
text: Oh, not really.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well, that's good.  I think she's a little sensitive, you know, about being replaced.  She's been doing me for ten years.

speaker: Amber
text: Oh!  But then she got pregnant.

speaker: Martin
text: Right, right.  But you know, lately, she's been having me up on the table.  I like it better on the floor.  The floor all right with you?

speaker: Amber
text: It's your dime.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, uh, maybe you could show me your stuff.

speaker: Amber
text: Oh...

speaker: Martin
text: I'll, uh, never hear the end of it if I don't take you out for a spin.

speaker: Amber
text: Oh, sure.  I just need to change.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, the powder room's right there.

speaker: Amber
text: Here?  Okay.

speaker: Daphne
text: Where did she go?  You didn't drive her off, did you?

speaker: Martin
text: No, not at all.  I like her.  What do you think about her?

speaker: Daphne
text: I like her a lot.

speaker: Martin
text: Good.  Of course, we won't really know until we see her in action.

speaker: Amber
text: Ta-da!

speaker: Martin
text: [_grinning broadly_] You're hired!   _Scene 7 - The country home Charlotte is seated at the table with Sue and Jonathan.  Frasier enters with Harbin, carrying Charlotte's suitcase._

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_desperately, forcing a smile_] Hi, sweetie!  You've been gone for twenty minutes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Well, uh, Harbin was just giving me a tour of my engine.

speaker: Harbin
text: You've got either a blown rod bearing or a loose pin.  If we had a stethoscope, I'm sure we could tell the difference.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, you know, I'm so hopeless with cars.  I know I would just misdiagnose it.

speaker: Harbin
text: Wouldn't be the first misdiagnosis that ever happened.

speaker: Jonathan
text: Friend Charlotte.  Where's your ring?

speaker: Charlotte
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Jonathan
text: I thought most married women wore a ring, yet your hand is bare and white.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it-it is.  That's because this is the hand that I fell in love with.  A hand too... too perfect for, uh... the profanity of gold or-or platinum. [_He sits, looking at her face._] After all, what diamond could possibly rival the sparkle in those eyes?  _During this speech, it is very clear the most of the sentiments he expresses are real, and not just spoken for Jonathan's benefit. Charlotte's flattered response to his words is also natural.  The moment they share is very brief, but palpable.  Harbin suddenly enters._

speaker: Harbin
text: I'll take my coffee in the living room, _you don't mind!_

speaker: Sue
text: If that will make you _happy_ , Harbin.  Shall we?  _Sue and Jonathan follow to the living room.  Frasier and Charlotte share a look of great trepidation.  They follow... and stop dead in their tracks when they see a coffin in the living room._

speaker: Jonathan
text: [_presenting the coffin, matter-of-factly_] This is Grandma.

speaker: Frasier
text: We... had no idea.

speaker: Sue
text: We... are having the wake here tomorrow.

speaker: Harbin
text: [_sobbing_] Mama... loved to party.

speaker: Sue
text: Excuse me again.

speaker: Sue
text: [_o.s._] Yeah, she loved to party all right.  With me as her personal slave and handmaiden, doing all the cooking and the cleaning and the wiping her sorry... [_re-entering, changing her tone_] Sugar?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, we're a bit tired, really.  Maybe we could just turn in?

speaker: Harbin
text: Well, help me get the cushions off the fold-up.  We'll make up the bed.  _He and Jonathan begin to remove the cushions from the couch in that room._

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean we're-we're sleeping in here?

speaker: Sue
text: [_deadpan_] Well, there's Mama's bed. [_then_] But that's in _our_ room.

speaker: Frasier
text: This'll be fine.  _Charlotte nods her agreement.  FADE TO:_  _Scene 8 - Later that night Frasier and Charlotte are in the hide-a-bed.  Frasier has dozed. Charlotte is sitting up, staring at the casket.  Then she hears an electric buzzing sound from somewhere in the house._

speaker: Charlotte
text: Did you hear that?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_waking_] What?

speaker: Charlotte
text: _That!_  What do you think he's doing down there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how should I know, he's _your_ friend.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Shh! _But they chuckle.  Despite everything that's happened to them that day, they are still easy enough with each other to laugh about it.  Footsteps are heard approaching the room.  They assume a sleeping position and close their eyes.  Jonathan enters and checks that they are asleep.  Then he opens the casket.  Frasier and Charlotte, watching him, are both horrified and amused._

speaker: Jonathan
text: [_sotto voce_] Grandma?  It's Jonathan.  I just wanted to tell you that our little secret is still safe. _He closes the casket softly.  Frasier and Charlotte again feign sleep as Jonathan checks them again, then exits.  They then sit up._

speaker: Charlotte
text: Well, this tops anything that would have happened at the Portland Radisson.  _They begin to laugh again.  Footsteps are again heard, and they re- assume the sleeping position.  Harbin enters, and opens the casket._

speaker: Harbin
text: [_voice breaking_] Hi, Mama!  I can't believe I'm not going to get one more hug. [_leans in_] What's that?  One more?  Ohhhhh... _He picks up the corpse and embraces it.  Frasier and Charlotte can barely contain themselves, quivering in bed and desperately muffling their laughter.  He glances their way and they "sleep" again._

speaker: Harbin
text: I better go, Mama.  I'm sorry I scraped your head with my watch. _He closes the lid, then kisses his fingers and puts them on the coffin. Frasier and Charlotte exchange another look, then resume their position before Harbin exits.  After he is gone, they break out in unrestrained, but quiet laughter._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know... he said the same thing to my engine when he opened the hood.  _Charlotte laughs.  Frasier joins her.  The mood between them is very playful and comfortable.  They lie facing each other._

speaker: Frasier
text: Charlotte... I'm afraid we're making a terrible mistake.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Frasier, I'm not switching sides again.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  I mean writing off these three weeks just 'cause you're moving.  I had a great time with you today, and with somebody else it would have been a disaster.

speaker: Charlotte
text: With somebody else, I would have been in Portland.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, you know what I'm talking about.  We have a lot of Fun together.  And why deny ourselves the chance to have even more?  I know the sensible thing would be to just end it now, and walk away.  And normally that's what I would do, but... I don't want to be sensible.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_with emotion_] But we'd only have three weeks.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.  It'd be like a summer fling.

speaker: Charlotte
text: But wouldn't we be sad when it ended?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course we would.  That's what happens.  You-you're sad When summer's over. [_then_] Well, I... never was.  I always looked forward to the new school year, when I would buy my books...

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_lovingly_] Are you going to talk all summer?  _They start to kiss.  The buzzing is heard again, and they sit up, smiling.  FADE OUT_
